But, at that, Jensen's completely lost it. His excitement erupts in the form of him JUMPING out of his chair and eagerly and elatedly HITTING HIMSELF in the head.
Sit down, Mr. Jensen!
Too late. OTHER PATIENTS are on their feet, HANDS jubilan up in the air. And, in the midst of the havoc, the speech order is soundly delivered in Becker's NOD to Damon.
Dr. Thatcher! Dr. Becker!

DAMON and HARDING grab STARKS while the other members of STAFF slowly calm the other patients. LORENSON is too bus notice them taking Starks out. STARKS winks at MACKENZIE, smiles somewhat sadly back.

location: MORGUE, BASEMENT, ALPINE GROVE, LATE NIGHT, 1992

text: HARDING and DAMON stand above Starks, who lies on the bru slab, already hemmed in the Jacket.
Starks, you're like a mule. You're real stubborn. But there's ways of fixin' that. All you need is a good stick. [Beat] Here's your stick.
DAMON slams him in the drawer.

STARKS' eyes dart about him; it sounds like something is there with him. The sound stops momentarily and, then, ou nowhere, a DROP falls on his eye. PING! STARKS winces. He clenches his face, not knowing when the next drop will fa His heart starts to beat more and more madly, punctuated the DRIPS -- making a score fit only for hell. He closes eyes and begins to die...

STARKS and TENNY -- 30s, shifty, a total stranger -- sit silence in TENNY'S CAR. (We recognize the murder scene.) POLICE LIGHTS FLASH in the rearview mirror though STARKS doesn't see them yet. STARKS and TENNY are talking to one another. TENNY's voic takes a dangerous tone.
You ever been to jail?
No.
TENNY nods, distracting STARKS long enough to slip a hand down his leg to the GUN he's hidden there.
It's worse than war. It's worse than anywhere you've ever been.
I doubt it. [Beat] I don't think prison's so bad you don't want to remember it...
TENNY carefully pulls over to the side of the road, assur and cautious with each word, each move.
Well, I've never been to war, but I'm sure as hell not going back to prison. STARKS [Finally spotting Harrison] What's he pulling us over for? TENNY [Still preparing himself] Recreation.
OFFICER HARRISON walks up to their car.
Gentlemen, I'm gonna need you to step out of the car, with your hands at your side please.
Why?
OFFICER HARRISON [Sternly] Step out of the car.
Ok, sir. I was just asking what for.
This is a stolen vehicle you're driving. Now put your hands in the air, out where I can see 'em.

That's the second when OFFICER HARRISON sees where TENNY' HAND is. As he reaches for his own GUN, the situation explodes as TWO FLASHES eclipse all else. OFFICER HARRISO goes down, still holding his own GUN and STARKS jumps out the car to check on him.
Jesus Christ, what'd you do that for?

TENNY looks around, still holding the GUN. Starks swallow assessing whether to back away or not. TENNY waves his gu he half points it in Harrison's direction. Then, GUN stil hand, he smirks nervously and looks at STARKS.
Man, if you're so deaf and dumb, you ain't even worth a fucking bullet.

TENNY raises the gun, then aims it away from STARKS and shoots OFFICER HARRISON once more. From the ground, OFFIC HARRISON fires back and STARKS, now lunging at Tenny, TAK THE HIT. STARKS falls, clearly unable to get up, let alone pursue anyone. TENNY smiles sardonically and slowly puts the GUN his back pocket as he turns to leave. This SMILE was one the eerie FLASHES that haunted Starks in the JACKET... STARKS struggles but can't move. That's when he passes ou looking at OFFICER HARRISON from the ground, as he did in scene before.

STARKS stands in the lighted tunnel, which only gets brig as his heart races with fear in the first seconds that he back in there. Then he sees an IMAGE of a WOMAN'S FOREHEA that lulls him to a calm until his heart slows and the LI gradually dims...

STARKS enters the diner, calming down even more as he spo JACKIE. She looks up, holding PLATES in her hand. She's understandably surprised and unexpectedly pleased when sh sees him. She greets him with a small smile. She drops off her orders and then walks up to him.
I'll be off in 15 minutes. Can you wait till then?
STARKS and JACKIE smoke in the cold, standing next to the hood of her car.
The Jacket. That's what they call it, right?
Yeah.

It was banned, you know... and it led to an investigation of Dr. Becker's mistreatment of some of his patients. That's when they found out how badly he was drugging his patients... STARKS [Starting to make sense] So he was giving me all kinds of drugs... JACKIE [Nodding] Apparently. He was taking a lot of them, too. It said he was trying out behavior modification treatments that were banned back in the 70s -- "womb treatment" is the name he gave to what he did to you... STARKS [Cutting in] Womb? A fuckin' womb? What kind of animal did he come out of?
But no one knew until after...
After I...
JACKIE nods.
[Beat] You bled to death.
What?
I don't know how you got the cut to your head, but you died bleeding from it. STARKS [Digesting] And you're sure my body was found on January 1st?
JACKIE nods.
Do you really believe me?

I don't know. [Beat] I thought I was crazy after you left that day. I died. I still think I could be crazy. But then I replayed that night in my head -- the parts of it I could remember -- and it was like...I don't care if I was, or am. I haven't felt that way in a room with someone my whole life. [Beat] And when you left, all I wanted was...
JACKIE looks around her; coupled with the cold, her sobri is obvious. STARKS takes hold of her and holds her face c to his so that their foreheads touch.
[Softly] I want to trust you. Should I trust you?
Yes.
Then we need to figure out what happened to you. It's the only thing we can do.
I know.
Alpine Grove still exists. I looked it up on the net. We should go there and see if there's still anyone around who might have known what happened to you.
If they don't take me out before then. [As an afterthought] What's the net?
JACKIE looks at him and laughs.

head_text.subj: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY

text: They are driving through VERMONT to ALPINE GROVE. STARKS looks out the window and watches her drive.
I didn't kill Officer Harrison.
I know.
How? Did they figure it out after I died?
No. They never figured it out. I did. Most murderers don't stop to help a drunk woman and her little girl on the side of the road. Not without hurting them.
STARKS and JACKIE sit opposite DR. MORGAN, the current yo face of the hospital. MORGAN has a boyish face and a matc gullibility.

I'm sorry I can't tell you more about your father's death, Mr. Starks. Our own medical examiners determined only that he died from a blunt trauma to the head but that was right around the time the Alpine Grove's staff changed and I'm afraid we didn't have the best record system before then.
His body was found on January 1, 1993, but do you know if that was long after he had died?
No, I don't. I'm sorry. I wish I knew more.
What about Dr. Thomas Becker or Dr. Loel Lorenson? There was also a Dr. Gries, I think.
Well, Dr. Lorenson is still here at the hospital. If she was here at the time your father was, then I'm sure she'd be of more help to you.
What about Dr. Becker and Mr. Gries?
Unfortunately, I'm not familiar with Dr. Becker and Dr. Gries passed away three, four years ago.
Do you have any kind of forwarding address for Dr. Becker?

Your father was here 12 years ago. I doubt the hospital would have that, if Dr. Becker is still even alive. [Beat, a little suspiciously] Is there a particular reason you need to know how your father died?
STARKS doesn't waver when he answers.
He was the only family I remember. DR. MORGAN [Nodding] I'll see what I can find out about Dr. Becker. And maybe Dr. Lorenson will know something.
Dr. MORGAN leads JACKIE and STARKS through a ward. STARKS looks around in disbelief; it's more like a hospital now it ever was in 1993.

location: RECEPTION AREA, LORENSON'S OFFICE, ALPINE GROVE, 200

text: As they arrive outside Lorenson's office, MORGAN turns to them.
Let me just tell her we're here.

DR. MORGAN goes inside and JACKIE takes STARKS' HAND as t wait. It's hardly more than a couple seconds when LORENSO appears in the doorway. She looks at STARKS curiously and two share a very lengthy, intense STARE. DR. LORENSON -- now in her 50s -- walks closer to Starks suspiciously. For his part, STARKS doesn't look as unfami with Lorenson as he should; this doesn't escape Lorenson.
Hello. I'm Beth Lorenson.
She puts out a hand that is trembling slightly.
It's nice to meet you, Mr. Starks...
STARKS hesitates before he takes Lorenson's hand. There i something very eerie about the exchange. STARKS quickly l go and LORENSON turns to JACKIE...
And you are...?
JACKIE looks back uncomfortably.
I'm just William's friend.
LORENSON looks over both of them acutely and then calmly turns to Dr. Morgan.
I think we'll be fine from here. Thanks, Stanley.
LORENSON leans against her desk while STARKS and JACKIE s in the chairs. As they talk, each seems cautious in his exchange -- not knowing what the other one does or doesn' know.
My God you look exactly like him.
I never knew my father. Did you?
Yeah, I did. [Beat] He was my most memorable patient.
Why?
LORENSON considers her answer.
At the end, he made me change my mind about a lot of things.
You thought my father was crazy?
No. I don't think he was crazy. He needed help...but he wasn't crazy. [Beat] Your father actually helped me with a case of mine.
LORENSON waits to see if STARKS knows what she is talking about.
What case?
I was working with a boy named Eugene.
STARKS shows no recognition but JACKIE does.
Who was Eugene? LORENSON [Peaked] He was a friend's son. [Beat] Are you familiar with the case?
Just a little, when we were looking up information about William's father. How did he help?
It's complicated, but [looking at Starks] in a way, your father let me know how I'd get through to him.
How?
He just said...that I'd shock Eugene and then things would change for him.
I don't understand.
I still don't either, even after all these years.
Do you know how my father died? LORENSON [Unconvincingly] I don't know how much I remember but I seem to think it was from a... cut or blow of some sort or another.
How'd he get it?
[Beat] I don't know.
But Dr. Morgan said you were around when my father was...
I was. But I saw a lot of cuts and a lot of blows. I'm sorry I don't know more about your father's. [Sincerely] I didn't know about everything that went on here.
LORENSON says it like she's hiding something.
Well, do you think Dr. Becker would have any idea?
How do you know about Dr. Becker?
My dad wrote some things down before he died.
LORENSON looks like she's suddenly remembering something.
That's right. He did.
STARKS looks at Lorenson curiously; he doesn't know what Lorenson is talking about.
So maybe Dr. Becker would know. [Beat] But, as I'm sure you know, the statute of limitations has run out for charging the hospital with any liabilities.
Why would we do that?
STARKS just stares at LORENSON, not knowing if he died by this man's hands or not, not knowing who he can trust...
Because Becker resigned after the charges brought against him by State Patient Advocacy Groups.

I see you've done your homework. [Beat] Alpine Grove's undergone a lot of changes since then. At the time, we didn't have the...resources to help our patients the way we needed to. [Beat] Now, we do. And things are different.
I wouldn't be so sure. Like you said about back then, you might not know everything going on around here.
DR. LORENSON looks right at STARKS.
It's important for you to know who your father was, isn't it?
[Beat] Yeah, it is. LORENSON [Eerily] It's almost as if your life depended on it. Isn't it?
Exactly.
Well... [beat] let me know how your search turns out.
[Beat] We will.

head_text.subj: INT. HALLWAY, ALPINE GROVE, DAY

text: STARKS and JACKIE walk briskly down it, away from Lorenso office.
I don't believe a thing she just said.
Me neither. Who was the boy she was talking about, Eugene?
I have no idea.
You think Lorenson kills you?
Maybe. I don't know. Seems more likely Becker does, but at the very least she knows how I died.
Let's see if they have an address for Becker. I also want to figure out more about the kid you helped her with.
Why?
Because that's the part I believe is true. You probably did help her somehow with the boy and Eugene's name did come up over and over again on the abstracts I pulled.
STARKS nods.
[Beat] There's one more thing I want to see.
STARKS, determined, now leads JACKIE. As they reach the e of the hall, we see DAMON -- now in his 50s -- look after curiously before he goes back to his work with a PATIENT.
JACKIE watches STARKS ignore the "Authorized Personnel On SIGN as he pushes the door open without so much as a paus
The morgue looks exactly as before. STARKS is momentarily jarred in the room. He looks to the wall on which the JACKET hung and sees only the BARE HOOK that used to hold it up.
This was the room. They used to hang the Jacket there. [Turning to Jackie] This is where it happened. This is the room I'm actually in right now.
JACKIE isn't doubtful, but it's also hard to be convinced...
I can show you. It's probably in there.

STARKS walks to the CADAVER DRAWERS and rests his hands o the one they put him in. Then, with great difficulty -- physical and emotional -- he opens it to see if there is anything left. He pulls it out, and there's nothing in there.
Maybe this wasn't such a good idea...

STARKS leans closer, locating all the proof he needs: the stained metal -- still reddened and browned with DRIED BL and the part of the morgue slab he CLAWED his NAILS into he was in it. JACKIE looks at it in disbelief.
Yes, it was. [Softly] My fingers were the only things I could move. [Beat] Dead bodies don't bleed. And they certainly can't claw so hard they dent metal.
STARKS and JACKIE are leaving the MORGUE, when STARKS spo DAMON, now hardly a hair of the bully he was before. DAMO stares at him curiously; STARKS glares back furiously.
You folks ain't supposed to be down here.
We were just leaving.
DAMON doesn't take his eyes off Starks.
Do I know you from somewhere?
You may have known my father, William Starks.
DAMON smiles, remembering...
That's right! Goddamn, you're the spitting image. I didn't know he had a son.
He didn't either. DAMON [With a dirty laugh] I'll be damned. He musta been 12 when he had you. [Beat] You could be his ghost.
Did you know my father?
Oh yeah, sure. He killed a cop, right?
STARKS looms strangely over DAMON in this exchange.
You wouldn't happen to know how he died, would you? DAMON [Slightly apprehensive] No, I don't. I just remember them finding his body.
You don't know any more, Damon? DAMON [Shocked] How'd you know my name?
My father used to talk about you.
Oh yeah, what'd he say?
Damon's eyes betray his unease.
He said you were a sadistic fuck that belonged in jail.
DAMON is shocked, and cowed. So much that he shakes as he looks for his bearings.
Look here, I don't like you getting in my face and saying this bullshit to me...
That's too bad.
I thought you said you never knew your father.
I didn't. [Beat] Did you have anything to do with his death?
I don't know what you're talking about, man. I swear. This is some weird shit you're telling me... and I don't know how come you're doing it.
STARKS starts to see a shaking man who stands confused an distraught before him.
He died because he bled to death from a blow to his head. Someone had to have given him it.
I never touched your father! I swear!
Damon's eyes are filled with dishonesty, tears and a crav FEAR. STARKS leans in closer to DAMON as he remembers...
You know something, Damon? You're like a mule. You're real stubborn. But there's ways of fixin' that. All you need is a good stick. [Beat] Here's your stick. Live with it.
STARKS looks like he could easily bash Damon's head again the wall, but instead he lets it go and walks away.

head_text.subj: EXT. CEMETERY, ALPINE GROVE GROUNDS, 2004, DAY

text: STARKS is standing above his own headstone: WILLIAM STARK December 25, 1967 - January 1, 1993. Next to his grave is of RUDY MACKENZIE. STARKS looks down sadly at both. JACKI comes up behind him.
How long do we have?
I don't know.
They told me Becker's in Shelbourne now. I looked him up and he was listed.
STARKS looks scared and lost -- like it's all catching up him. And like he might be being taken out of the Jacket.
How far away is that? 82.

head_text.subj: PAGE MISSING

text: JACKIE kisses his SCARS -- from the war and the Jacket -- STARKS lifts her higher so he can look at her as they mak love for the first time.

head_text.subj: INT. BEDROOM, JACKIE'S APARTMENT, NIGHT

text: JACKIE is lying in STARKS' arms, running her FINGERS over of the SCARS on his chest. STARKS strokes her hair.
What about Captain Medley? He never told them what happened to you over there. His testimony...that coward wanted them to think you were crazy.
I know. It was perfect. [Beat] Erase my sanity and you erase anything I'll ever say. JACKIE [Frustrated] Well, doesn't what he did to you make you mad?

Of course it makes me mad. It makes me more than mad. Just like remembering the face of the man who killed that officer and knowing nothing more about him. But what's it gonna do for me to find them now? I can't fix everything in three days.
You've got to get yourself out of that place. They're going to kill you if you don't.
I might not be able to.
It's not a prison, it's a hospital. There's got to be some way out of there and you've got to find it...
She doesn't finish because it's too hard to. STARKS nods, wiping her tears and kissing her.

The sore sound of the DRAWER being opened stirs Jackie -- awakening her as if she heard it in her sleep. She reache across the bed, but STARKS is no longer there. She runs h hands over the bed like he's alive in the sheets.

DR. LORENSON is administering medicine to a patient in th ward, when she sees -- almost like a shadow -- a STRETCHE being wheeled down the hall. She finishes with the patien and runs to the end of the hall in search of it...

location: STARKS' ROOM, ICU, ALPINE GROVE, LATE NIGHT, 1992

text: STARKS lies recovering under a small light above his hosp bed. His body bears marks of the brutalization. As we pul back, we see DR. LORENSON standing guard over him at the of his bed.

head_text.subj: EXT. WARD, ICU, ALPINE GROVE, NEXT MORNING

text: STARKS sits by a window -- I.V.'s in his arm -- smoking f still severely weak from the Jacket, while DR. LORENSON observes him for a bit from the hall before she goes insi
You'll die if you keep smoking those in your condition.
I'll die either way.
LORENSON pulls up a chair and sits opposite him.
I can't try to help you unless you let me. [Beat] I know about the Jacket.
STARKS waits to see what this means.
I'm sorry for what you were put through, and I'm sorry I couldn't stop it earlier. But I promise you that I will from now on... STARKS [Cutting him off] I don't want you to.
LORENSON doesn't understand.
What do you mean?
You have no idea what's going on.
No, I do. That's what I'm saying to you.
Listen to me! You don't! The Jacket is my only chance in this place.
LORENSON just thinks it's another delusion.
How can you say that in your physical condition? Do you realize that it's because you were put in it that you're as...weak as you are now? Becker's a man who's not well himself.
STARKS searches for words that won't sound as crazy as he knows he appears. They don't exist.
You don't understand.

Then help me understand. You know, you're not alone. A lot of Gulf Vets have begun to experience curious symptoms. What you have might well be a syndrome and, if so, it's not one we know enough about to be treating it this vigorously.
This has nothing to do with that. LORENSON [Exasperated] Then what? What? [Beat] I can't guess it. You have to help me.
STARKS fixes his eyes on Lorenson. He has nothing to lose still he treads carefully. The words that follow come alm unwittingly.
...What you do not know is the only thing you know.
STARKS (cont'd) [Beat] And what you own is what you do not own... And where you are is where you are not.
[Beat] Where is that from?
It's as though STARKS hears his words for the first time.
I don't know. [Frustrated] Remember?
Come on. Tell me what you do know.
[Beat] I've seen a time that's not this time. And I'm only able to see it when I'm in the Jacket.
Well, what time is it?
LORENSON nods, trying to mask his dismay but failing.
You don't believe me. LORENSON [Testing him] Well, what year do you think it is now? STARKS [Exasperated] I'm not delusional. I know it's 1992. Same as every sane person.
Ok fine. Tell me about it. Tell me about the future. 2004. What does it look like?
It doesn't look all that different.
The future doesn't look different?
No. Not for people like me. [Beat] Not in the places I come from.
What about the world?
I didn't see that much of it -- same as now. I only saw it as part of my own life.
LORENSON looks at STARKS, unintentionally patronizing.
Do you think you're traveling in time? Is that it?
STARKS shakes his head and momentarily challenges Lorenso simply with his air of calm resolve.
Not everyone in here is crazy, Doc.
LORENSON searches for another approach.
[Beat] Like who? Like MacKenzie maybe?
Maybe. LORENSON [Matter-of-factly] Did he tell you he tried to kill his wife?
STARKS nods.
MacKenzie locked himself up in his house for two months and nearly starved himself to death before he was brought here. All because his wife left him for another man.

STARKS moves to put his cigarette out and his I.V. almost falls out of his arm. LORENSON makes a move to adjust it STARKS flinches perceptibly, startling LORENSON. STARKS [Adjusting it himself] Maybe that just makes him weak, not crazy. Or maybe he is crazy. [Beat] Still doesn't make me think I am.
STARKS [Adjusting it himself] And, judging by the fact that you just told me about another patient, it doesn't even make you think I am, so what don't you work on persuading yourself first.
Why don't you help me?
Because I don't have time.
Why not?
I'm about to die unless I do something to stop it.
And how do you know that?
Because of the future. I know what's going to happen.
William, that is just another facet of my delusions.
Then, STARKS remembers the only thing that might help him pauses, trying to recall as much of it as he can.
And what about your work with Eugene -- the kid? Is that another facet of my delusions?
LORENSON -- having prepared to continue -- is bowled over the mention of her patient. She loses all color and calm her features.
How do you know about Eugene?
You told me about him. I saw you and I think you thought I knew something about him. So you told me.
LORENSON doesn't know what to say. LORENSON [Somewhat angrily] How do you know about Eugene!?
STARKS [Shaking his head in disbelief] You told me. It's like two parts of you talking through me. Look, judging from your reaction, there's no other way I could know about him.
There obviously is, so what don't you just tell me how you found out about him.
STARKS looks at her convincingly.
Some part of you suspects -- even if you don't know for sure -- that what I'm saying is true.
I don't know how you know about Eugene, but these ideas are part of your delusions.
NO! They're not my delusions! Look, just leave my business with Becker to me!
One thing's got nothing to do with the other.
One's got everything to do with the other. So unless you want my blood on your hands...leave what's between me and Becker between me and Becker.
LORENSON backs off, jarred by Starks' assertions and fear of his debilitating vehemence.
MACKENZIE sits idly on one of the hallway benches until t hallway is clear of the STAFF. Then he scuttles quickly - the time close to the wall -- to Starks' room.
MACKENZIE gets inside, ducks as a NURSE passes and then t lightly on the wall, announcing himself gladly.
Hey, I brought you some smokes.
STARKS doesn't waste any time.
Lorenson said your wife left you for another man and that's when you lost it.
MACKENZIE almost imperceptibly winces -- confirming the t for Starks -- before he has to sit down.
Geez, how's that for a fucking "thank you"?
Is it true?
MACKENZIE tosses him the CIGARETTES and lights himself on
She left me, I tried to kill her, I tried to kill myself. She was mean, I was weak, I was cruel so she left, I didn't plan it, didn't see it...FINE!

MACKENZIE suddenly stops, distraught. When he resumes, it in an oddly more normal tone than he's ever used before. MACKENZIE [Softly] I didn't want to see it. I'm in here because they say I have a nervous condition. [Beat] Well, here's my question, who wouldn't be nervous if they really looked at their life? [Beat] Whose life is that good?
STARKS doesn't have an answer.
Not this luckless little mammal's. What difference is it to them? [Beat, slows down] You believe what you want to believe. One version is easier than another so you make it your own.
As MacKenzie runs his hand over his forehead, he looks hu and sad, but strangely not a bit crazy.
I'll tell you this though. However nuts I am, I wasn't nuts enough not to know how wrong it was to put a human being in something like that.
MACKENZIE's twitching continues as he recollects it.
MacKenzie, [beat] what if we are crazy?

[Shrugging] What if we are? There're crazier things than thinking up fictions for yourself. [Beat] Everyone does it, don't they? Even Becker. That roller coaster car pops more pills than all of Ward 3.
Becker does? Are you sure?
I've been here for 11 years. It's my neighborhood. 'Course I'm sure. He's as drugged up as the rest of us...I guess he has to be to put up with all this.
STARKS nods and MacKenzie puts his head down, suddenly vulnerable and embarrassed. STARKS lights TWO CIGARETTES.
Thanks for the cigarettes. You still got a lot of problems, MacKenzie, but you're ok.

MACKENZIE and STARKS smoke together quietly. INT. STARKS' ROOM, ALPINE GROVE, DECEMBER 29th, 1992 STARKS is trying to see if the windows open through the b covering them. It's especially hard with the I.V. still connected to one of his arms.
At least it's some kind of bars we've got you behind.
STARKS turns, startled.
Hello, William. I understand you've been asking for me almost every hour. I would've been here sooner but you gave our little state visitor quite a bit to talk to me about.
That's too bad.
It is. But when it comes down to it, you just have to patient with them. They'd rather have their vacation, too, so they just push dealing with our "practices" off to the New Year.
They make it hard for you to get away with your business, huh?
Temporarily.
STARKS lights a cigarette and, with that gesture, adopts unscrupulousness of a criminal so convincingly it bears little resemblance to his usual demeanor.
Makes it a little easier for me to get away with mine.
BECKER looks at STARKS seriously.
And what's that?
My business?
Yes.
Getting away with things. Like whatever I may or may not have gotten away with Officer Harrison.
You killed him?
STARKS simply delivers one slow nod.
And wound up in a better cage. [Beat] But I still want to make a deal.
BECKER looks understandably disgusted and STARKS proceeds with the calculation of someone who is guilty.

See, the deluxe lab animal treatment I've been receiving -- well, I don't think it's worked. I woke up today and realized... [eerily lowering his voice] ...I don't think I'm cured. So really, what was the point? Torture? I think that's still sort of illegal in some states -- though we'll have to check on Vermont. And, how's this for the cherry on top: it seems my physician is a pill-popping freak. [Beat] Last time I checked, that makes some pretty good copy for a lot of these news shows. [Humbly, deftly] "I don't remember everything they did to me. I just remember the worst parts." I think I should be sitting down when I say it, don't you think?
It takes BECKER some seconds to swallow this.
I think...I have to think about it.

BECKER cocks his head to one side as he does. Then he slo makes his way over to STARKS and leans in closer to him. STARKS instinctively raises his hand to his HEAD -- prepa to be defensive if he has to be. If this is the moment wh he's killed. But BECKER only YANKS the I.V. angrily out of Starks' arm tearing his skin with it.
I think your story needs a little fleshing out before it's ready to go.
BECKER turns to leave as STARKS bleeds onto the floor.
I'll say a prayer for you in Church today, Starks. Maybe the Gods can pick up where the medicine left off.
You sure you know where to find one?
I've managed to every Sunday of my life. [Beat] Some of us are God- fearing men, Starks.
And what does that mean?
Means we believe in doing his work and fear what the world would be like if we didn't at least try to.
STARKS smirks at the hypocrisy he sees.
Becker, how do you sleep at night?
You in here. [Beat] Works like a drug.
BECKER leaves without looking back and STARKS closes his eyes, breathing a sigh of relief that it's over.

head_text.subj: INT. NURSE STATION, ALPINE GROVE, 1992, EVENING

text: LORENSON, dressed to leave, stops to talk to NINA, one of evening nurses.
Nina, William Starks is to stay in ICU all night. If anything is supposed to change, I want to be called about it.
Sure, Dr. Lorenson.
LORENSON comes home to an unremarkable apartment to find thin, young mother, TALIA YAZDI, and her eleven year-old mute, and seemingly retarded son, EUGENE, waiting for her outside her door.
Hi. [Beat] Sorry I'm late.
It's ok. [To Eugene] Hi, Eugene.
EUGENE returns her greeting with a blank stare.

head_text.subj: INT. LORENSON'S HOME, VERMONT, SOME TIME LATER

text: LORENSON sets her things down on the kitchen table as TAL starts to tidy things around the apartment.
Talia, I need to ask you something.
TALIA looks at LORENSON.
What is it?
Have you told anyone about my sessions with Eugene? TALIA [With an accent] Of course not. [Off Lorenson's still doubtful look] I swear I haven't. I wouldn't do that to Eugene, or you. You know that.
Has anyone been asking about him?
No. I would have told you.
LORENSON nods. She believes her.
STARKS spots DAMON standing cautiously in the hall.
We see (but don't hear) HARDING speak to NINA as DAMON sl into STARKS' ROOM. NINA seems sufficiently distracted.

head_text.subj: INT. STARKS' ROOM, SECONDS LATER

text: DAMON flashes a KNIFE at STARKS.
No funny business or we can make this a lot fucking harder for you.
One look at the KNIFE and the SAME QUESTION burns once mo
[Weakly] No funny business.
DAMON hustles Starks down the hall as fast as they can be the NURSE or any other staff member spots them.

head_text.subj: INT. OFFICE/LIBRARY, LORENSON'S HOME, NIGHT

text: EUGENE sits opposite LORENSON, who quietly observes him, jotting some notes down on her pad. She is intermittently holding up PICTURES for Eugene, asking him to repeat thei names as if she were teaching him to read.
Eugene, this is a "TRAIN."

EUGENE starts to pronounce the word when abruptly, and without any warning, he looks like he's unconscious, only with a blank stare. Lorenson quickly moves beside Eugene watches him from up close, apparently not altogether surprised at what's happening. EUGENE doesn't even blink. The only sounds we hear from h are a couple, barely audible guttural noises. LORENSON -- exhausted -- takes off her glasses wearily and gently addresses the boy.
Come on back down here. Wherever you are...try to come on back. You'll like it, I promise.

Just then, TALIA walks in with TEA, JUICE and COOKIES for Eugene and Lorenson. She spots her son in his absent, sta state and forces her face into a small, sad smile to avoi tears as she sets the tray down and the cookies before th TALIA gently touches LORENSON'S hand. LORENSON looks at h warmly. TALIA knows how hard she's trying.
BECKER soundlessly watches as HARDING and DAMON finish strapping Starks in the Jacket. DAMON slams the DRAWER shut, sending STARKS back in.
What STARKS lacks in strength, he counteracts with his OVERWHELMING WILL. The SCREEN TREMBLES with it. One TERRI WHITE LIGHT and we...

head_text.subj: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, SHELBOURNE, VERMONT, 2004, DAY

text: STARKS sits by himself in Jackie's car, parked in a gas station. He looks around, trying to make sure it really i her car. He looks in the back and sees a pair of sneakers an empty BOTTLE of VODKA. He looks outside and sees a few people walking into the F MART of the gas station. He trembles with cold as he look down at his plaid shirt. Then, JACKIE unexpectedly appears outside the DRIVER'S WI opening the car door and nearly spilling her COFFEE when spots STARKS next to her. Seeing it's him though, she smiles warmly.
You just scared me, that's all.
She leans over to him and gives him a kiss, handing him t coffee.
Me, too.
Here, drink this. I'll get the heat going.
JACKIE speeds through the streets of Shelbourne, presumab on their way to Becker's house.
They've slowed down a little.

head_text.subj: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY

text: JACKIE reads from some directions on a PAPER as their CAR slows down on one particular street, towards one particul house.

head_text.subj: EXT. BECKER'S HOUSE, SHELBOURNE, 2004, DAY

text: I think this is his house.

head_text.subj: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY

text: STARKS looks at the house, bedecked with a lopsided SNOW on the front lawn.
You're sure?
Yeah. I called the number yesterday to make sure. Thomas Becker, retired M.D.
STARKS gets out of the car.

head_text.subj: EXT. BECKER'S HOUSE, SHELBOURNE, 2004, DAY

text: STARKS knocks on the door. No answer.

head_text.subj: EXT. BECKER'S HOUSE, SHELBOURNE, 2004, DAY

text: JACKIE tries to look through the windows to see if anyone there. No one is. It looks small and dark inside.

head_text.subj: EXT. BECKER'S HOUSE, SHELBOURNE, 2004, DAY

text: STARKS knocks again, looking down anxiously at his feet. JACKIE walks up to him from around the side of the house. They don't have the time to wait.
They're not here.
They're not.
[Beat, lost] No.
JACKIE notices how COLD Starks looks.
Maybe they're out.
STARKS nods.

head_text.subj: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY

text: STARKS rubs his hands together as he looks out the window and sees NO CARS or PEOPLE on the street. JACKIE watches despairingly.
How much time do we have? STARKS [Distracted] I don't know.
What? What are you thinking?
There're no cars on this street.
JACKIE looks around; there really aren't.
Yeah, you're right. But wait, how can that be?
STARKS turns to JACKIE, thinking.
I don't know. Maybe that's because this whole thing is a dream. How can you have a street with no cars on it?
I don't know. But this isn't a dream. I'm real, and so is where we are.
Then why isn't there anyone around?
[Beat] I don't know.
STARKS runs his hand over his head and closes his eyes in desperation.
What are you doing?
STARKS doesn't answer.
William! William!
STARKS opens his eyes. She sighs in relief.
Maybe he's gone somewhere. He'll have to come back.
STARKS starts to shake his head in disbelief, when sudden he realizes...
Of course he will. [Beat] What day of the week is it?
It's Sunday. STARKS [Nodding] It's Sunday.
So?
STARKS looks ecstatic with hope.
Look where these people live.
A small, beautiful, removed place.
They've got lives to be grateful for.
William, you're not making sense.
[Beat] They're at Church. And I bet that's where Becker is.

JACKIE and STARKS head back to the only MAIN STREET in th town. As they approach the town church, they start to see ROW of cars parallel-parked on the street. JACKIE pulls up to the entrance of the CHURCH.

head_text.subj: INT. JACKIE'S CAR, 2004, DAY

text: STARKS watches JACKIE get out of the car and walk up to t doors of the CHURCH.
JACKIE boldly opens the CHURCH door.
JACKIE sees the town seated in the Church. The PRIEST loo up at her briefly and some people turn around, but she cl the DOOR before she causes a major interruption.

We move to the third or fourth row, where, from behind, w see a head of GREY HAIR. He slowly turns around, casting look towards the door and revealing a glimpse of his face Though it's aged slightly, it hasn't softened.

JACKIE and STARKS watch as the people file out of Church. They are leaning against her car when STARKS spots him. DR. BECKER walks beside a SMALL CHILD -- presumably his GRANDSON. JACKIE registers his formidableness with some surprise; Becker's maintained a strong physique and is ha a shade less intimidating than he was before. Only his ha has a permanent shake now. STARKS doesn't waste any time. He heads straight for him. Almost sensing him, BECKER looks in his direction. The ca look on his face is instantly supplanted by one of DISBEL
You still go to Church. How's that work? Your God just doesn't notice? That it? [Beat, serious] How you doin', Dr. Becker?
BECKER stops walking and looks at Starks. His GRANDSON lo at him.
Grandpa? BECKER [Still looking at Starks] Sean, why don't you wait for me by the car? I'll be there in a minute. [Turning to the kid] Ok?
His grandson, momentarily appeased, heads for the car. BECKER [To Starks] Can I help you?
I don't know, Dr. Becker. Can you?
That's enough to confirm for BECKER who STARKS is. All around them, people leaving Church socialize routinel unaware of the haunted history being made between them.
Who are you?
I think you know. Your eyes say you do.
[Beat] You're his son?
No. I'm not his son. I'm him. [Beat] What? You look like you've seen a ghost. You can come here and touch me, old man. I'm the real thing.
How...how are you here?
STARKS looks at Becker -- each a terrifying reminder of t other's past.
You died, Starks. Years ago, in the hospital.
I know. [Beat] You killed me, didn't you?
No. I didn't. I swear I didn't. I probably helped push you to kill yourself, but I didn't do it.
I didn't kill myself. I died from a blow to the head. How'd it happen? I have to know.
BECKER looks at him, nearly too stunned to speak.
I don't know how you died. The last time I put you in the Jacket was just after you told me you remembered killing that police officer...
I didn't say I remembered killing him. I just repeated some words to get myself back in there.
I know. [Beat] I knew that when you came out.
How?
Because...because you came out and said something you couldn't have possibly have known. You came back and repeated three names...
BECKER falters as he recalls his offenses.
Of people like you. People I was just trying to help. They couldn't get worse so I thought, with medication, they might get...
Medication? What kind of meds do you chase with nights in a cadaver drawer?
It was part of the treatment I intended...I didn't know what the effects would be...
So, what, you guinea pig sick people to find out?
The three of you weren't regular patients. You were criminals that ended up at Alpine Grove.
No, we were patients.
BECKER concedes after all this time.
You and the others didn't seem that way then.
STARKS is quiet as he comes to understand how it's about work out: if Becker tells him those names now, he essenti indicts himself.
Who were the others?
BECKER remembers with a hint of remorse. BECKER [Racked with remorse] Nathan Piechowski, Jackson MacGregor, and Ted Casey. [Beat] I didn't ask for you -- for any of you. You were all sent to me.
STARKS looks at Becker, in astonishment.
What is it?
STARKS just stares at Becker, waiting for the realization hit him, too.
How did you come to know their names?
You just told me. The last time I was with you was when I was in the Jacket. I'm in it right now, Dr. Becker.
I don't understand...

I'm in it as we speak. [Beat] You're haunting yourself right now. [Beat] I guess sometimes we indict ourselves if no one else does. You didn't make history like you wanted to, huh, Dr. Becker. It turned out different, didn't it?
I didn't put you in Alpine Grove.
No. [Beat] You put me on drugs and then you put me in the Jacket.
BECKER [Stoically] I was sorry when I heard you died. I was, but...how was I to know you didn't shoot that police officer?

The same way you just said I didn't without my ever telling you. [Beat] And that still doesn't excuse what you did. Just because you had keys to a cage didn't mean you had animals inside. [Beat] You've earned your guilt, Becker.
STARKS shares a last look with Becker before he walks awa towards the car.
JACKIE and STARKS sit inside the parked car as STARKS tou his head.
That's all you got from him? That bastard helped take your life away from you.
No, he didn't.
What? How can you say that? He's the one that put you in that goddamn medieval...Jacket. He's probably the one who killed you.
And with those words, JACKIE starts to break down.
No one's killing anyone.
STARKS takes her hand and runs it over his head.
Touch me. I'm okay.
STARKS looks at her with love, understanding and, for the first time, a sense of peace. He strokes her hair to calm down.
If everything hadn't happened the way it has, then I wouldn't be here right now, sitting in a car with you, touching your face.
Why are you saying that? [Beat] We don't have long, do we?

STARKS looks at her without answering. JACKIE wipes her e fastens STARKS' seat belt, and seeing that Starks' EYES h started to flutter, starts driving. In the distance, the barely audible sound of the DRAWER opening, and their tim ending, is heard.
Where are we going?
To the hospital.
JACKIE and STARKS speed on the highway. As STARKS sleeps, JACKIE keeps looking over at him like it's a way to make he stays with her.
JACKIE helps STARKS -- who's severely weakened at this po to the nurse's station. CLAIRE is there.
Claire, I need help.
CLAIRE helps JACKIE, and they take him into a room. From afar, we hear CLAIRE asking about him.
What's happening to me? Why am I getting so much weaker?
Because your body can only take so much of what they're putting you through.
Jesus, what's happened to him?
JACKIE helps CLAIRE do for STARKS what they can; it doesn seem like much at this point.
Lorenson's the only one that could let me out of there. I need something to persuade her that I was there. Get me something to take to her.
Ok. Ssh. Rest.

JACKIE stands above a PRINTER as it prints the informatio she's looked up about Dr. Lorenson. The PAPER gets jammed and that's when JACKIE completely loses it. She WRESTLES the printer as if it were responsible for what's happenin Then she realizes she's not alone. She looks back and see CLAIRE, watching from the doorway, with a sympathetic loo her eyes. JACKIE [In a panic] He's not...?
No, no. [Beat] Not yet. But he doesn't have long. Are you sure you don't want a doctor to look at him?
No! It won't do any good. [Beat] Please, Claire. They won't understand.
CLAIRE acquiesces with her eyes.
STARKS is trapped: back on the day when Officer Harrison murdered.

location: HIGHWAY, RURAL VERMONT, WINTER, LATE AFTERNOON, 1992

text: (Cont'd from the scene after STARKS left Jean and Jackie' place):

STARKS is walking back on the same highway just after the has set, and just after he helped JEAN and JACKIE, on tha fateful day... This time we see a CAR stop for him from a much closer distance. TENNY pulls up towards STARKS and rolls down th window on the passenger side. STARKS bends down to be abl see the driver.
Hey, Mister, you need a ride?
Where are you going?
I'm going to Canada but I can let you ride with me up to the border.
STARKS considers this.
Can you drive?
Sure.
Great, get in. We'll switch off in a bit.

We pull back and see the same SHOT, from a distance, of STARKS putting his BAG in the back and getting in. As he opens the CAR DOOR, we hear the MUSIC playing inside. As drive off, the MUSIC fades further and further in the distance as we...

head_text.subj: INT. BEDROOM, JACKIE'S APARTMENT, NIGHT

text: It's the night that they slept together, and the departur never saw. We see, from Starks' POV, JACKIE sleeping serenely in the bed. We catch one glimpse of STARKS in the moonlight, standing naked in the doorway, before he turns and then...disappea having been taken out of the Jacket at that point.
JACKIE is by STARKS' side, lying on the hospital bed, nex him, smoothing his sweating head.
William, please, honey, wake up. For me.
STARKS' eyes flutter open.
Can you hear me?
STARKS nods; JACKIE tries to continue without choking up.
I found out about Eugene. The little boy. He's the key. That's who you have to tell her about when you get back there. It's the only way to prove this to her.
JACKIE's VOICE fades as we...
LORENSON watches EUGENE continue to look unresponsively in the distance.
STARKS is awake, watching JACKIE sleep wearily on his che He sees the TOLL this has taken on her, just as he senses is about to be taken out of the Jacket. He nudges her gen
Jackie?
JACKIE stirs her eyes to look at him. STARKS [Somewhat urgently] Where do you live?
What?
When we first met, when you were 7, where was the house you lived in with your mother? Do you remember your address?
112 Orchard Way. [Realizing, in a whisper] You're not coming back, are you?
STARKS, faint, struggles to get out of the bed.
You gotta stop thinking like that.
Then, where are you going?
Nowhere. [Beat] I just think I'm gonna be sick.

STARKS   moves towards the bathroom of the hospital room. JACKIE   moves to help him and he motions for her to stop STARKS   falters in the doorway when he turns to look bac Jackie   -- like it might be for the last time. JACKIE [In a whisper] You come back to me...

STARKS nods, then goes in and closes the door behind him. JACKIE stares after him -- alone in the total silence of room. She listens for the slightest noise and that's when actually hears the sound of the DRAWER being opened for herself. She realizes he's gone. She RUSHES after him, opens the d in a fit, and then, sees what she feared most: no sign of Starks. JACKIE falls to her knees, right there, on the bathroom floor and cries out like a woman only beginning realize how unfathomably deep her heart is...

STARKS is suddenly in the waiting area outside Lorenson's office -- still severely weakened. He walks slowly to the OFFICE DOOR and feebly knocks. LORENSON answers and STARKS falls into her arms. LORENSON [Stunned] Oh dear God.
LORENSON has laid STARKS down on the COUCH in her office. STARKS can barely talk. He spews as much of it as he can in his feverish state...
I'm William Starks. I'm not his son. And...and the kid you work with. Your friend's son...Eugene...
LORENSON is stilled by the words STARKS just spoke.
I know. I know it all. Save your strength. I already know everything you're going to say. [Beat] You're in the Jacket right now, aren't you?
How...how do you know?
You told me this was how it happened.
I did?
Yeah.
STARKS clutches his side in pain as they prepare to take out.
Who...who kills me?
You have nothing to fear, William.
But when we look to see STARKS' reaction, he's not there.

head_text.subj: INT. BECKER'S OFFICE, ALPINE GROVE, EVENING

text: BECKER is dressed to leave the hospital when he suddenly decides not to. He takes off his coat and his gloves, but his SCARF, and walks out of his office with a decided urgency.

BECKER pulls STARKS out of the drawer and looks down ruef at STARKS' scathed face. STARKS, drenched in BLOOD and SW seeks the outline of Becker's face in the light. STARKS [Whispering] Becker, I know about you. [Beat] I know what you did to your patients.
BECKER looses the straps around Starks' neck to help him speak.
Nathan...Piechowski. [Beat] Jackson MacGregor...Ted Casey. [Beat] You didn't cure them. You killed them.

BECKER momentarily loses color and his forever cool mien. After some seconds, STARKS passes out and BECKER -- hands trembling -- looks as though he might stick him back in w instead, he starts to remove him from the Jacket himself. silently and carefully unties each of the straps -- takin unusual care for Starks' flesh as he prepares to put him stretcher.

head_text.subj: INT. STARKS' ROOM, ICU, ALPINE GROVE, EARLY MORNING

text: As the SUN starts to rise, we see STARKS -- now cleaned u recovering in his bed. He is unconscious. From his window look down and see Dr. Lorenson's car pulling into the lot

head_text.subj: INT. STARKS' ROOM, ICU, ALPINE GROVE, EARLY MORNING

text: LORENSON, still wearing her winter gear, walks into Stark room, anxiously checking his VITALS. Her anxious expressi reveals Starks' frailty. She looks to the window then and sees an empty chair with only Becker's SCARF on it. LORENSON goes to the window in time to see BECKER getting into his car.

location: STARKS' ROOM, ICU WARD, ALPINE GROVE, LATER THAT MOR

text: STARKS lies unconscious in the bed. The NURSE, SALLY, sto by the room to check on Dr. Lorenson.
Would you like anything, Dr. Lorenson?
A cup of coffee would be great, Sally. Thanks.
Is he gonna be ok?
I hope so.
Me, too.
LORENSON looks after her as she leaves.

location: STARKS' ROOM, ICU WARD, ALPINE GROVE, MORNING, 1992

text: LORENSON wakes up as STARKS stirs in his sleep, slowly wa up.
You're going to be ok, William. We just need to get your fever down and we'll be able to hopefully stabilize you.
Who are you kidding, Doc? You or me?
LORENSON doesn't answer.
Can I get some paper and something to write with.
What for? STARKS [Solemnly] I'm starting to think I'm really gonna die soon. So I'd like to write some things down.
I'm not gonna let that happen.
You still don't believe me, do you?
I do believe you...
No. Listen to me...the kid, Eugene...
LORENSON still gets taken aback by Starks' knowledge of Eugene.
No one knows you're working with him so how would I have found out? He's your friend's son, right?
It's true; no one could have known about Lorenson's priva life. STARKS coughs, clearly in great pain.
William, I can't indulge these delusions, even when you're in this state.
Listen to me. That's all I ask.
LORENSON has no choice.
He's having absence [pronounced "absance"] seizures when he stares off into space like he does. He has them so often that that's why he hasn't learned to speak properly.
Who told you this?
You did, in the future. You figured it out because a part of you already knows this. That's how it works. [Beat] I'm just telling you something you already know, even if you haven't realized it.
STARKS closes his eyes, gathering what strength he can.
I don't know when it'll happen but soon I think, you'll shock the boy and it'll wake him up.
What are you talking about?
You'll figure it out and you'll do good by him.
That's all STARKS can manage before LORENSON sees he's ab to pass out again.
LORENSON answers the KNOCK at her door. It's EUGENE and TALIA.
Hey.
What is it? LORENSON [Finding it hard to explain] Nothing. [Beat] I don't know. I thought of something I could try.
LORENSON looks at TALIA helplessly. TALIA nods and leads Eugene inside. LORENSON can't help but look down the hall make sure no one's there.
LORENSON sits across from EUGENE, holding up a picture of DOG. Between them is a tray of MILK and COOKIES.
Come on Eugene, try to say it with me. This is a "DOG".

But Eugene can't hold the sound of the letter long enough make the word. An absence seizure takes hold of him as he looks out unconsciously into space. LORENSON moves closer to him. LORENSON [Softly] What's happening to you?
LORENSON checks Eugene's pulse and leans in close to the boy's unconscious face like the answer is there if she ju looks hard enough.
Are you having a seizure? Is that really what's going on?
LORENSON spots a corner of Eugene's EYE twitching slightl and, rushing to get a better look, takes the shade off of nearby LAMP and holds it above his head so she can get a better look at him.

Just then, TALIA opens the door, startling Lorenson. She knocks over the MILK and, as it spills on the LAMP CORD - on Eugene's lap -- it causes an ELECTRIC SHOCK. Eugene ca it. TALIA gasps and Lorenson watches the boy in fear. The moment passes and Eugene -- more responsive than he h ever been before -- looks at his mother and Lorenson. He doesn't know what's happened but he is aware, and awake, like never before. EUGENE picks right up where he and Lorenson left off.
Dog. [To Talia] Hi.
TALIA and LORENSON look at him and each other at shock. STARKS [O.S., distantly] You're going to...shock the boy and then things will change for him.
You ok, Eugene?
EUGENE holds Lorenson's gaze steadily for a few moments. LORENSON [Stunned himself] Yeah, you are ok.

What's happening? LORENSON [Putting the pieces together] He got a little shock. [To himself] And it's reset him. Not permanently probably...but at least for a little while. They use it on epileptic patients sometimes...
But he's not epileptic.
No, but he is having seizures.
TALIA looks at LORENSON. She's still confused. LORENSON's merely surprised.

location: STARKS' ROOM, ICU UNIT, ALPINE GROVE, 1992

text: STARKS looks up from his PAPER -- now covered in WORDS -- see Dr. Lorenson in the doorway. STARKS still looks weak much better than before.
It worked, didn't it?
LORENSON nods.
This is really happening, isn't it?
[Beat] What do you need me to do?
[Beat] Thank you.
STARKS folds the LETTER.
I need to get this letter to someone.
I can't take you out of here in your condition...
And I can't stay here in my condition. I am going to die tonight. It's already been decided.
No, it hasn't.
Yes. [Beat] It has. Everything up 'till today is done. Everything starting with tomorrow is up for grabs.
LORENSON helps STARKS into the parking lot as it snows.
LORENSON and STARKS are driving on the same, now familiar highway.
You know how to get there?
Sure. It's an easy address. A little far out there, but easy enough.
Good.
Bob Dylan plays on the RADIO. STARKS smiles as he hears h and turns the music up; the act is sad because, as LORENS notices, it belongs to someone with an interest to live.
DR. LORENSON and STARKS drive up to Jean and Jackie's hou
You want me to come with you?
No, I'll be ok.

STARKS slowly makes his way to their front door and knock it as best as he can. The sound, however, is still understandably soft. STARKS waits and then reaches for the knob on the door. H opens it and looks inside. We first see his face, and the devastation on it, as we guess the sight he's laid eyes o JACKIE is sitting at the kitchen table, still only 7 year old. Though STARKS expected it, he falters under the disappointment of seeing a girl he liked instead of the w he loved. As she looks up at him, it's all he can do not break down.
Hi. JACKIE [Surprised] Hey. [Beat] I remember you.
I remember you, too.

STARKS shakes his head, looking at her. She looks beautif and still hopeful. Her life lays ahead of her and her fat when he found her in 2004 -- remains as distant as possib from this innocent, still promising image.
Jackie, how have you been?
JACKIE smiles; she doesn't get asked that often.
I've been ok.
Good. How's your mom?
Ok, I guess.
STARKS nods. JACKIE smiles. It's all he can do not to crumble.
Do you think I could see her?
She looks at him and senses, like kids do, the desperatio his eyes.
Sure.

JACKIE calls out for Jean, then runs up the stairs to get her. LORENSON has gotten out of the car and is waiting outside on the porch. STARKS remains in the doorway. Some seconds later, JEAN appears -- gaunt but in a slight better state than we saw her before.
Can I help you?
Hey, Jean. Nice to see you.
JEAN looks a little confused.
I'm sorry? Your face looks awfully familiar, I just can't quite place it...
Mom, this is the guy that drove us home that afternoon we were stuck on the highway. The guy you yelled at for no good reason...
Oh, yeah.
She gives him a once over, and, seeing how weakened he lo decides intuitively he can't be much harm. She also notic LORENSON waiting by the car.
There something you need?
You could say that.
STARKS looks at JACKIE, hesitating because of her. Sensin this, JEAN asks Jackie to leave.
Jackie, go play in the snow.
Why?
Just do it.
JACKIE leaves and walks to the yard. STARKS watches.
I can't stay long. [Motioning to Lorenson] That's my doctor and I gotta get back to the hospital. Everything I want to say is in this letter. [Beat] You can check as much of it as you can.
STARKS hands her the LETTER.
I won't be around when you read it...but I hope you believe it. It'd be a real shame if you didn't.
JEAN looks baffled but, seeming to grasp his urgency, nod
[Beat] I should be on my way.
JACKIE has been watching this exchange from the shed. Whe looks over there, he catches her eye and CALLS OUT, with strength he has left...
Bye, Jackie.
These are the hardest words STARKS has probably ever had say. JACKIE just stares after him, as does JEAN, as he sh himself out.
Happy New Year to both of you.
Thanks. You, too.
As STARKS is walking away, we see his eyes begin to tear the cold -- but not from it.
JACKIE abruptly runs after him.
Hey, wait!
STARKS stops in his tracks; he clears as much sadness fro his face as he can before he turns around to face her.
[Beat] You be good to yourself, Jackie.
Ok.

Then, suddenly, she sticks her hand for him to shake, as did that day on the roadside; only now, it trembles sligh in the cold. STARKS takes JACKIE'S HAND and holds it in his own softly affectionately. JEAN and DR. LORENSON look on curiously a STARKS looks in her face, at her hand in his, and then to heavens for the means to get through this. As STARKS lets go at last, JACKIE looks back at him, sens the connection even if she doesn't know it yet. STARKS turns and stumbles as he walks back to his car. LORENSON moves to help him, but STARKS tells her not to w his eyes. He makes his way to the car on his own.

location: LIVING ROOM, JEAN AND JACKIE'S HOUSE, DAY, 1992

text: JEAN sits down and starts to open the LETTER. Starks' voi as we hear it now, is presumably from parts of the LETTER he's written to her.
LORENSON looks over to STARKS, who stares painfully out t window. They drive on in silence.
I was 25 years old the first time I died. It didn't end anything though. [Beat] Sometimes I think we live through things only to be able to tell them, to bear witness, to say this happened.
STARKS walks back through the gates of the hospital, despondently returning inside, with LORENSON at his side.

And it wasn't to someone else. It was to me. And I lived despite it. Sometimes I think we live to beat the odds. And sometimes I agree that life can only begin with the knowledge of death. That it can all end, even when you least want it to.

head_text.subj: INT. WARD, ALPINE GROVE, EVENING

text: MACKENZIE looks up from his game of solitaire as LORENSON helps STARKS down the hall. He holds up his hand in the gesture of hello, or goodbye. STARKS raises his hand back with an earnest smile.
I'm telling you my story because it's the only way I can try to help your daughter, and you, have a better one of your own.
We see BECKER taking his DRUGS. In his dark den, on his w desk, is a bottle of WHISKEY. He closes his eyes as he administers to himself whatever aid he can...

location: JACKIE AND JEAN'S HOUSE, DAY, DECEMBER 31, 1992

text: JEAN is reading each page avidly, affected by this man's words.

It's scary...and lucky...how much we can forget. Scary because we think the past gives us our bearing, and lucky because in those moments I'm talking about, you realize it doesn't. And it never had to.
TENNY (Officer Harrison's murderer) is at the bar orderin drink from the BARTENDER. As he gets his DRINK, he slaps BILL down on the counter and turns around to survey the b

Over the sounds of CARS slushing in the snow, an IMAGE fa up slowly on the screen, until we see it's STARKS, standi in the parking lot outside the diner once more. This time he seems situated, and hopeful. After a slightl longer wait than the first time, JACKIE walks out -- in t same way as before except that she wears a NURSE'S UNIFOR and an unmistakable air of vitality. Jackie looks directly at Starks and we see the same attraction between them teeming even more than before. Ev as a physically injured man in jeans and a flannel, with BLEEDING CUT on his head and no coat in the cold, STARKS someone we see she wants to be near. Then we see JACKIE as STARKS does: she looks beautiful, alive, happy and just like the woman he never wanted to leave. She approaches Starks warmly, less suspicious of t world -- and less devastated by it -- than we remember he being.
Hey there. [Beat] You ok?
STARKS revels in the moment. In their reunion.
I think so.
You're bleeding pretty bad there.
STARKS touches his FOREHEAD in a panic and, seeing the BL on his hands, looks up at her, terrified. Sensing this, s moves closer to calm him.
It's ok. It's ok. Relax. It's just a cut. We can get it fixed.
JACKIE (cont'd) But we need to get you to the hospital now. How'd you get that?
I fell down. [Beat] But I'm alive.

STARKS looks at her -- immensely relieved and grateful. JACKIE [Laughing a little] Yes, you are alive. But, listen, it's New Year's Day. You're not going to get a cab. Especially not here. And you're gonna freeze if you stand out here in the snow much longer. I'm on my way back to my shift at the hospital...
You work there? JACKIE [Gesturing to her uniform] Yeah, I'm a nurse. Why don't you let me give you a ride...
STARKS falters slightly as he walks. JACKIE helps him mak to the car, much like before...
Thanks.
STARKS can hardly keep his eyes off her when her CELL PHO suddenly rings.
Sorry, one sec.
JACKIE answers it, smiling.
Hey! How are you? [Beat] Thanks. I was just thinking about you, too.
STARKS listens nervously to her conversation and the affection in her voice.
Listen, I gotta go, mom, 'cause I'm late... but, thanks. Happy New Year to you, too. I'll call you later. [Beat] Ok, bye.
JACKIE hangs up and looks at Starks -- feeling a little awkward after the call.
Sorry about that. It was my mom.
STARKS smiles back warmly at her; he gets it more than sh knows.
Nothin' to worry about there.
Jackie's car pulls onto the highway, alongside the other, more modern cars on the highway.
How you doin'?
I'm doing fine.

The happy sound of their engine on the highway continues, uninterrupted, for some seconds, before, first faintly th louder, we hear a racking, all too familiar sound: the DR creaking as it's opened once more...
